wikipedia_page.main: Stanley Rickaby (12 March 1924 – 8 February 2014) was an English footballer who played as a right back.

response: | DF ||align="left"| Stan Rickaby || 12 March 1924 || 1 || 0 || 90 || 0 || 0 || - ||bgcolor=red| 90 || - ||align="left"|  West Bromwich Albion

At West Bromwich, he made his debut as a centre-forward before switching, firstly to wing-half, before settling into the full-back position. In 1954, Williams helped West Bromwich to reach the runners-up position in the Football League and seemed certain to replace the injured Stan Rickaby in the FA Cup Final, but manager Vic Buckingham opted instead for the more experienced Joe Kennedy.

After having had an administrative position with a Dutch side, in January 1959 he became successor of Stan Rickaby at Southern League club Poole Town.Keeping Gets Poole Job, Daily Mail (London), 21 January 1959, p. 9.

Kennedy suffered a leg injury in 1953–54 and lost his place to Jimmy Dugdale. However, he was called upon to replace the injured right-back Stan Rickaby for the 1954 FA Cup Final against Preston North End, which Albion won 3–2. When Dugdale left to join Aston Villa, Kennedy became Albion's regular centre-half for most of the remainder of the decade.
* 3 March 2014: Stan Rickaby, 89, former England, Middlesbrough and West Bromwich Albion right back.
